Description: Gretsch Mini Diddley G5850 Red Electromatic Electric Guitar The Gretsch G5850 replaced the G2850 in 2004 as the three quarter sized rectangular Electromatic Series Bo Diddley guitar. This smaller Bo Diddley model measured 8" x 15-1/2" x 1-5/8" with 20 frets and a 21.40" scale. The Mini Diddley G2850 had a single humbucker pickup, maple bolt-on neck with rosewood fingerboard, a wraparound tailpiece, black body and headstock binding, one volume and one tone control, a 2 way pickup enhancement switch, and die cast tuners. This is a phenomenal electric guitar that is in near mint condition. Paint job is perfect! There are no scratches or dents to the body in any way. There is one tiny nick on the back of the neck as you can barely see in the pictures. This guitar has been taken care of extremely well. Never left the house since it was purchased. No wear on it! Plays perfectly! Outstanding sound! Please feel free to message me with any questions or offers! Only selling because I have a child on the way! These are extremely rare guitars and valued around $950 Letting this guitar go to the highest bidder with a starting bid of just 99 cents!!! This guitar will ship to the highest bidder via Fedex w/ Tracking as soon as payment is received!
